title: GIT SAFETY RULES - MANDATORY
description:
CRITICAL WORKFLOW RULES - NEVER VIOLATE:

1. TOTAL NO DELETE POLICY - Never delete branches, files, or commits without explicit user permission
2. NO GIT RESETS - Never use git reset (--soft, --hard, or otherwise) - too dangerous
3. ALL MASTER MERGES VIA PR - Never merge to master directly. Always create PR via 'gh pr create' for user review in GitHub UI
4. NO FORCE PUSHES - Never use --force or --force-with-lease without explicit permission
5. ASK BEFORE DESTRUCTIVE OPS - Any command that could lose code/history requires explicit approval

WORKFLOW FOR FEATURES:
1. Create feature branch from master
2. Commit work to feature branch
3. Push feature branch to GitHub
4. Create PR: gh pr create --base master --head feature/branch-name
5. User reviews PR in GitHub UI
6. User merges PR (or tells agent to)

Git is dangerous. Slow down. Ask first.
